alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:16PM CST until January 18 at 12:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Pearl River, St. Tammany, Washington and Hancock Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 18... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Bogalusa. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Wednesday, January 18. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Woodlands and crop acreage along the river will be flooded. The Bogue Chitto Wildlife Management area will be inundated with water in recreational camps and over access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday evening to a crest of 18.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, January 17. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/07/1959. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued tomorrow morning.
